xtc.lang.cpp

Class ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax

  • java.lang.Object
    • xtc.lang.cpp.ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax
  • Enclosing class:
    ForkMergeParser

    public class ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax
extends Object
    A syntax object and it's sequence number, buffered in a linked-list so that multiple subparsers can read tokens from the same stream. It references a stack of nested conditions in order to store the sequence number of the conditional in which each token lies.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax

        public ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax(Stream stream)
        Create a new ordered syntax object. A call to getNext() on an OrderedSyntax object created with this constructor will return the first token from the stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream from which to pull new tokens.

      • ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax

        public ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax(Syntax newSyntax,
                             ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax old)
                              throws IOException
        Create a copy of an ordered syntax object using a different syntax object. This is useful for reclassifying tokens due to parsing presenceCondition.
        Parameters:
        newSyntax - The new syntax object.
        old - The old OrderedSyntax object to duplicate sequence and next token information from.
        Throws:
        IOException - This constructor must call getNext(), which throws IOException.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax copy(Syntax syntax)
                                   throws IOException
        Create a copy of this object using a new Syntax object.
        Parameters:
        syntax - The new syntax object.
        Returns:
        A new OrderedSyntax object.
        Throws:
        IOException - because it calls getNext().

      • getNext

        public ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax getNext()
                                      throws IOException
        Get the next token from the stream and assign it the next sequence number.
        Returns:
        The next token.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getSequenceNumber

        public int getSequenceNumber()
        Get the sequence number of this token. The token sequence numbers are strictly monotonically increasing from the start of the file to the end.
        Returns:
        The sequence number.

      • getParentConditional

        public int getParentConditional()
        Get the sequence number of the this token's parent conditional. This method is undefined when the token is a conditonal itself.
        Returns:
        The sequence number of this token's parent conditional.
